lindelt.either

Class Either<L,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • lindelt.either.Either<L,R>

  • public abstract class Either<L,R>
extends Object

    Container holding a concrete instance of one of two types of values. If an Either holds a left value then isLeft() returns true and isRight() returns false, and vice-versa if an Either holds a right value. Either objects are not permitted to hold null values.

    Either can be broadly thought of in three ways:

    1. A data-focused alternative to error handling that allows non-Throwable signals and doesnâ€™t unwind the call stack.
    2. A rich Optional that provides contextual information with the empty case.
    3. A generalized binary summation type containing equally valid values.

    An Either used as in points (1) or (2) conventionally has a valid value stored as a right Either (mnemonic: right is correct).

    Since:
    0.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Either()
      Empty constructor for an Either.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Either<T,R> applyLeft(Either<Function<? super L,? extends T>,? extends R> applicative)
      Gets a left-holding Either holding the result of mapping the function held by the provided Either to the value held by this Either if both Either objects are left-holding, otherwise gets a right-holding Either holding either the right value of the provided Either if it is right-holding, or the right value of this Either if the provided Either is left-holding.
      <T> Either<L,T> applyRight(Either<? extends L,Function<? super R,? extends T>> applicative)
      Gets a right-holding Either holding the result of mapping the function held by the provided Either to the value held by this Either if both Either objects are right-holding, otherwise gets a left-holding Either holding either the left value of the provided Either if it is left-holding, or the left value of this Either if the provided Either is right-holding.
      void consume(Consumer<? super L> leftConsumer, Consumer<? super R> rightConsumer)
      Conditionally performs an action using the value held by this Either.
      void consumeLeft(Consumer<? super L> consumer)
      Performs an action using the left value held by this Either if this Either holds a left value, otherwise does nothing.
      void consumeRight(Consumer<? super R> consumer)
      Performs an action using the right value held by this Either if this Either holds a right value, otherwise does nothing.
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares the specified object with this Either for equality.
      <T> Either<T,R> flatMapLeft(Function<? super L,? extends Either<? extends T,? extends R>> mapper)
      Gets the result of applying the mapping function to the left value held by this Either if this Either holds a left value, otherwise gets a right-holding Either containing the right value held by this Either.
      <T> Either<L,T> flatMapRight(Function<? super R,? extends Either<? extends L,? extends T>> mapper)
      Gets the result of applying the mapping function to the right value held by this Either if this Either holds a right value, otherwise gets a left-holding Either containing the left value held by this Either.
      <T> T fold(Function<? super L,? extends T> leftFolder, Function<? super R,? extends T> rightFolder)
      Conditionally folds this Either into a single value via left and right folding functions.
      <T> Optional<T> foldCast(Class<T> castType)
      Unconditionally folds the Either into a single value via type-cast operation.
      abstract L getLeft()
      Gets the left value held by this Either.
      L getLeftOr(L fallback)
      Gets the left value held by this Either or a fallback value if this Either holds a right value.

      Gets the left value held by this Either or a fallback value if this Either holds a right value.

      Lifts a function to return an Either object.
      <T> Either<T,R> mapLeft(Function<? super L,? extends T> mapper)
      Gets a left-holding Either holding the result of applying the given mapping function to the left value held by this Either (as if by left(Object)) if this Either holds a left value, otherwise gets a right-holding Either holding the right value of this Either (as if by right(Object)).
      <T> Either<L,T> mapRight(Function<? super R,? extends T> mapper)
      Gets a right-holding Either holding the result of applying the given mapping function to the right value held by this Either (as if by right(Object)) if this Either holds a right value, otherwise gets a left-holding Either holding the left value of this Either (as if by left(Object)).
      Optional<L> maybeLeft()
      Gets an Optional describing the left value held by this Either, or an empty Optional if this Either holds a right value.
      Optional<R> maybeRight()
      Gets an Optional describing the right value held by this Either, or an empty Optional if this Either holds a left value.
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> of(Optional<? extends R> maybe, L fallback)
      Creates a new Either using an Optional and a fallback value.
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> of(Optional<? extends R> maybe, Supplier<? extends L> fallback)
      Creates a new Either using an Optional and a fallback supplier.
      static <R> Either<Exception,R> of(Supplier<? extends R> supplier)
      Creates a new right-holding Either using the value returned by the Supplier, or a left-holding Either containing an Exception if the Supplier throws.
      static <R> Either<Throwable,R> ofChecked(Supplier<? extends R> supplier)
      Creates a new right-holding Either using the value returned by the Supplier, or a left-holding Either containing a Throwable if the Supplier throws.
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> right(R right)
      Creates a new Either holding a right value.
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> right(R right, Class<L> leftType)
      Creates a new Either holding a right value.
      Stream<L> streamLeft()
      Creates a Stream holding the left value held by this Either if this Either holds a left value, otherwise creates an empty Stream.
      Stream<R> streamRight()
      Creates a Stream holding the right value held by this Either if this Either holds a right value, otherwise creates an empty Stream.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Either.

    • Method Detail

      • lift

        public static <T,U> Function<T,Either<Exception,U>> lift(Function<? super T,? extends U> function)
                                                  throws NullPointerException
        Lifts a function to return an Either object. If the provided function returns successfully for a given input, the lifted function returns a right-holding Either holding the result of applying the provided function to said input, otherwise the lifted function returns a left-holding Either containing the Exception thrown by the provided function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Input type of the provided function.
        U - Return type of the provided function.
        Parameters:
        function - Function to be lifted.
        Returns:
        A function that returns an Either object based upon successful return from the provided function for a given input.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided function is null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • liftChecked

        public static <T,U> Function<T,Either<Throwable,U>> liftChecked(Function<? super T,? extends U> function)
                                                         throws NullPointerException
        Lifts a function to return an Either object. If the provided function returns successfully for a given input, the lifted function returns a right-holding Either holding the result of applying the provided function to said input, otherwise the lifted function returns a left-holding Either containing the Throwable thrown by the provided function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Input type of the provided function.
        U - Return type of the provided function.
        Parameters:
        function - Function to be lifted.
        Returns:
        A function that returns an Either object based upon successful return from the provided function for a given input.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided function is null.
        Since:
        1.0

        public static <L,R> Either<L,R> of(Optional<? extends R> maybe,
                                   L fallback)
                            throws NullPointerException
        Creates a new Either using an Optional and a fallback value.
        Type Parameters:
        L - Type of the left value.
        R - Type of the right value.
        Parameters:
        maybe - Optional that may hold a right value.
        fallback - Fallback left value.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the Optional is null, or the Optional is empty and the fallback is null.

      • of

        public static <R> Either<Exception,R> of(Supplier<? extends R> supplier)
        Creates a new right-holding Either using the value returned by the Supplier, or a left-holding Either containing an Exception if the Supplier throws.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of the right value.
        Parameters:
        supplier - Supplier producing a right value.
        Returns:
        An Either holding a right value if the Supplier successfully returns a non-null value, otherwise a left-holding Either containing an Exception.
        Since:
        0.2

      • ofChecked

        public static <R> Either<Throwable,R> ofChecked(Supplier<? extends R> supplier)
        Creates a new right-holding Either using the value returned by the Supplier, or a left-holding Either containing a Throwable if the Supplier throws. Similar to of(Supplier), but capable of holding Error or other throwable types.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of the right value.
        Parameters:
        supplier - Supplier producing a right value.
        Returns:
        An Either holding a right value if the Supplier successfully returns a non-null value, otherwise a left-holding Either containing an Exception.
        Since:
        0.2

      • mapRight

        public <T> Either<L,T> mapRight(Function<? super R,? extends T> mapper)
                         throws NullPointerException
        Gets a right-holding Either holding the result of applying the given mapping function to the right value held by this Either (as if by right(Object)) if this Either holds a right value, otherwise gets a left-holding Either holding the left value of this Either (as if by left(Object)).
        Type Parameters:
        T - Return type of the mapping function.
        Parameters:
        mapper - Mapping function to apply to the right value held by this Either, if this Either holds a right value.
        Returns:
        A right-holding Either holding the result of applying the mapping function to the right value of this Either, or a left-holding Either holding the left value of this Either.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If this Either holds a right value and the mapping function is null or returns null.
        Since:
        0.5

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A left-holding Either holding the result of applying the mapping function to the left value of this Either, or a right-holding Either holding the right value of this Either.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If this Either holds a left value and the mapping function is null or returns null.
        Since:
        0.5

      • applyRight

        public <T> Either<L,T> applyRight(Either<? extends L,Function<? super R,? extends T>> applicative)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Gets a right-holding Either holding the result of mapping the function held by the provided Either to the value held by this Either if both Either objects are right-holding, otherwise gets a left-holding Either holding either the left value of the provided Either if it is left-holding, or the left value of this Either if the provided Either is right-holding.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Return type of the applicative function.
        Parameters:
        applicative - An Either which may hold an applicative function.
        Returns:
        A right-holding Either if both Either objects are right-holding, otherwise a left-holding Either holding the left value of the provided Either or this Either, in that order.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided Either is null.
        Since:
        0.6

      • applyLeft

        public <T> Either<T,R> applyLeft(Either<Function<? super L,? extends T>,? extends R> applicative)
                          throws NullPointerException
        Gets a left-holding Either holding the result of mapping the function held by the provided Either to the value held by this Either if both Either objects are left-holding, otherwise gets a right-holding Either holding either the right value of the provided Either if it is right-holding, or the right value of this Either if the provided Either is left-holding.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Return type of the applicative function.
        Parameters:
        applicative - An Either which may hold an applicative function.
        Returns:
        A left-holding Either if both Either objects are left-holding, otherwise a right-holding Either holding the right value of the provided Either or this Either, in that order.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided Either is null.
        Since:
        0.6

        Parameters:

      • fold

        public <T> T fold(Function<? super L,? extends T> leftFolder,
                  Function<? super R,? extends T> rightFolder)
           throws NullPointerException
        Conditionally folds this Either into a single value via left and right folding functions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Return type of the folding operation.
        Parameters:
        leftFolder - Function used if this Either holds a left value.
        rightFolder - Function used if this Either holds a right value.
        Returns:
        The result of applying the appropriate folding function to the value held by this Either.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the selected folding function is null.
        Since:
        0.4

      • foldCast

        public <T> Optional<T> foldCast(Class<T> castType)
                         throws NullPointerException
        Unconditionally folds the Either into a single value via type-cast operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type to cast the value held by this Either to.
        Parameters:
        castType - Class object of the type to cast the value held by this Either to.
        Returns:
        An Optional containing the value held by this Either cast to T if the cast was successful, otherwise an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided class object is null.
        Since:
        0.4

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Compares the specified object with this Either for equality. Returns true if and only if the specified object is also an Either, both Either objects are of the same direction (left/right), and the values held by both Either objects are equal. (Two values v1 and v2 are equal if v1.equals(v2)).
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be compared for equality with this Either.
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to this Either.
        See Also:
        hashCode()

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()

        Returns the hash code value for this Either. The hash code of an Either is defined to be the result of the following calculation: 

        
 int hashCode = 1;
 hashCode = 31 * hashCode + (isLeft() ? getLeft().hashCode() : 0);
 hashCode = 31 * hashCode + (isRight() ? getRight().hashCode() : 0);

        This ensures that a.equals(b) implies a.hashcode() == b.hashCode() for any two Either objects, a and b, as required by the general contract of Object.hashCode().

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        The hash code value for this Either.
        See Also:
        equals(Object)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this Either. The string representation consists of a leading "Either.Left" or "Either.Right", followed by the string representation of the held value in square brackets ("[]").
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this Either.
